poem:
### Overreaching

Tesco, the ancient Colossus,  
once stretched its legs across the Atlantic,  
dreaming of empires in Fresh & Easy aisles.  
But hubris stood on the shelf,  
price-tag undiscounted,  
and the old ledger's weight,  
pulled back from slippery dreams,  
to counting beans at home—  
the day job's silent refrain.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Tesco is unbeatable when it concentrates on the day job | Nils Pratley It is 17 years since the management of Tesco suffered a severe case of hubris and thought they could conquer the US. A supposedly small experiment with a format called Fresh & Easy ended in an embarrassing retreat and a near-£2bn write-off. And it is 10 years since the great accounting scandal and the bullying of suppliers, a crisis era mixed up". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
